page.title: 01Introduction, Bridgham Area
page.content:
Our area lies in Norfolk's Breckland: a region of light sandy soil, with heathland as the natural landcover. However, in the last 50 years, reafforestation has been followed by land reclamation for farming. Much of our block now shows a prosperous forest and farming landscape, whilst also retaining one of the best remaining examples of the wild, sandy heaths or brecks in the west of the block.
Bridgham village, a linear development along the Thetford_Harling road, paralleling the River Thet, continues into the neighbouring block; however, information has been concentrated within this block. It is a small community of approximately 250, stable in size and unlikely to grow within the foreseeable future.
